thread.title: Armajaro will close commodities fund by month-end -source
thread.title_full: Armajaro will close commodities fund by month-end -source

title: Armajaro will close commodities fund by month-end -source
text:
Print 
(Adds details on fund throughout) 
NEW YORK, July 27 (Reuters) - London-based Armajaro Asset Management LLP will close its loss-making $450 million commodities fund at the end of the month, a source familiar with the matter said on Monday, the latest hedge fund to close up shop as investors flee the sector. 
The closure comes just three months after John Tilney stepped down as lead manager of the fund, which was launched just over a decade ago and invested in base and precious metals, energy, soft commodities, grains and livestock. 
According to the letter to investors seen by Reuters, the fund was down 9.8 percent in the first five months of the year, including a 5.2 percent drop in May. 
The flagship CC+ fund, run by prominent cocoa and coffee trader Anthony Ward, will continue to operate, the source said. 
(Reporting by Josephine Mason and Barani Krishnan; Editing by Bernard Orr)
